abstract: ABN Amro, the largest Dutch bank, said Monday it had agreed to be acquired by Barclays of Britain in a $91 billion deal that would be the largest financial-services merger in history. To fend off a rival group of bidders seeking to break up the 183-year-old bank, ABN Amro and Barclays struck a separate agreement Sunday to sell the LaSalle Bank of Chicago, a unit of ABN, to the Bank of America for more than $21 billion.
lead_paragraph: ABN Amro, the largest Dutch bank, said Monday it had agreed to be acquired by Barclays of Britain in a $91 billion deal that would be the largest financial-services merger in history. To fend off a rival group of bidders seeking to break up the 183-year-old bank, ABN Amro and Barclays struck a separate agreement Sunday to sell the LaSalle Bank of Chicago, a unit of ABN, to the Bank of America for more than $21 billion.

headline.main: Barclays Agrees to Buy ABN Amro in $91 Billion Deal
